The movement of trees could create new paths and routes for animals and humans to navigate through the forest.
Trees could potentially help with natural disaster response, such as moving out of the way to avoid flooding or clearing debris after storms.
The ability of trees to walk could lead to new forms of transportation and exploration, as people could use tree-powered vehicles or simply walk alongside the trees.
Trees could potentially help with environmental conservation efforts, such as moving to areas where they can help combat climate change or protect endangered species.
The movement of trees could lead to new forms of art and entertainment, as people could use the trees as performers or create tree-based performances.
